level.heading: Alienability of debtor's rights: judicial process.
level.text: The debtor's rights in collateral may be voluntarily or involuntarily transferred (by way of sale, creation of a security interest, attachment, levy, garnishment or other judicial process) notwithstanding a provision in the security agreement prohibiting any transfer or making the transfer constitute a default.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For Law 13-201, see notes following ยง 28:9-101.
